body.name: Braun BrewSense 12-Cup Drip Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel - PureFlavor & Fast Brew System - Three Brew Modes - 24-Hour Programmable Timer - Dishwasher Safe
body.stockDetail: Only 19 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 10 hrs 21 mins
Or fastest pickup Friday, February 16. Order within 10 hrs 21 mins
features: Drip Coffee Maker - With Fast Brew technology, this machine brews up to 12 cups of coffee in under 10 minutes. BrewChoice lets you select from three brew modes—Fast, Regular, or Bold—while the Freshness Indicator tracks freshness.

Pure Flavor - PureFlavor technology ensures your coffee is made at the right temperature and brewing time to extract the best coffee flavor and aroma. The FlavorCarafe minimizes air exposure and ensures coffee stays warmer for longer.

Easy to Use - This machine features a touch screen with an LED display and a programmable 24-hour timer. You can even pause and pour mid-brew with virtually no mess. Plus, a 1-4 cup button brews smaller quantities without compromising on taste.
Dishwasher Safe - With the automated descaling warning, the machine will inform you when it needs to be cleaned. Plus, the removable parts are dishwasher safe.

Designed for What Matters - People everywhere turn to Braun when it counts the most: Whether they want to prepare that special dinner for a first date, iron their best shirt for an important event, or make breakfast for the whole family.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Our Fastest Brew Twelve cups of flavorful coffee in under 10 minutes. Customizable Brew Cycle Select from three brew modes: Fast, Regular, or Bold. Touch Screen Interface The touch screen display and easy-to-read LED selections replace conventional buttons. Consistent Flavor The right temperature and brewing time extract the best coffee flavor and aroma.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020
reviews.reviewText: After a few years of pour-over coffee and extensive overthinking, I decided to purchase this coffee machine.There were a few things I deemed important in my coffeemaker search. First, I wanted to be able to schedule my coffee to brew just before I wake up and zombie-shuffle into my kitchen. Second, I wanted a machine that could make more than 6-8 liquid cups. When family visits, the pour over carafe capacity is never enough so we’re constantly making third or fourth carafes of coffee daily. That gets time consuming and very annoying. Third, it was important to still have great flavor. Pour over and has a great taste and I did not want to lose that. Finally, I wanted the coffee to stay hot. My glass pour-over carafe cooled too quickly and I’d have one mug of hot coffee before I had to begin microwaving, which doesn’t keep coffee hot for very long, either.I decided to buy this coffeemaker after reading reviews on several machines at a few different online stores. I chose this Braun after reading many pretty good reviews. The price was doable and I really liked the aesthetic I saw in the pictures.I got the machine yesterday and set it up. It came with a charcoal water filter (lasts a year) and a cone shaped, reusable mesh coffee filter. The charcoal filter is not necessary to the operation of the machine but IT’S A FILTER, people. Although I already have a water filter attached to my kitchen faucet, the charcoal filter comes with the machine, so I’m using it. There are specific instructions on how to activate the filtering properties of the charcoal pod so be sure to read those in the manual before inserting it into the machine.The reusable mesh basket looks very nice but I haven’t tried it because I have several paper filters (cone, size #4 fits perfectly) and I like the flavor of the coffee when I use them. When I run out, I’ll likely switch to the reusable filter.When I set up the machine yesterday, I ran the machine through once with only water, as recommended by the manufacturer, to remove dust that may have settled into the machine. I timed this cycle for funsies (on the “regular” brew setting) and it took a little under 10 minutes to fill the carafe. I have not tried the bold or fast brew settings yet. After this initial cleaning cycle, I washed the pot and mesh filter.Setting the time, water hardness level, and the auto-brew function was easy with the manual, but you do have to push the power button before you can activate certain features. I feel it is pretty important to read the instruction manual. Side note- after I set the clock, I unplugged the machine while I poured water into the water tank (because I don’t want to get electrocuted, plus the manual says to do this). I did not have to set the clock again after I plugged it back in. That was a neat little function.Last night, I set the auto-brew function to make coffee at 8:30 am this morning. It worked great, the coffee stayed hot, and it tasted awesome! And if you, like me, slowly go through a pot of coffee throughout the morning and early afternoon you can turn the warming plate on again. Press the power button, then the “brew” button and it will keep the plate hot for another 2 hours.All in all, I have no complaints so far and I’m very happy with this purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bought a Used one?
reviews.reviewText: I thought I bought a "used" return coffee pot for like 73 bucks. Turns out the box was a little beat up but the machine was completely unused and brand new. So far, this thing blows my Hamilton Beach out the water. The coffee I've been drinking for years just honestly tastes better and it's much much hotter. Great buy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My 5th Braun coffeemaker - still the best!
reviews.reviewText: In 15 years of owning Braun Coffeemakers, they are still, hands down, the best maker of coffee. I've tried smaller, cheaper, espresso makers, etc. & they all wound up in the garbage. I make 4 cups daily, 365 days per year and I am very fussy about good coffee. I use Illy Cafe' blends or Major Dickason's for a morning wakeup treat!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Overall easy to use, some ergonomic issues....
reviews.reviewText: The coffee maker is overall well designed and the touch interface is easy to navigate. The clock tends to lose time rather quickly, so keep the directions handy as setting the clock is un-intuitive. Everything works well, except for the carafe, which ALWAYS dribbles some coffee. This seems to be a persistent Braun problem, so unsure why it has never been fixed. I have not used the included gold filter as in the past these have left much more residue in the pot/cup than paper filters. Bottom line, it make a good, hot cup of coffee. I have only used it with small batches, never brewed a full pot so cannot comment on that performance. In my experience, coffee makers are usually at their worst with SMALL batches, so I would imagine this would work well for full pots. The machine is well made, attractive and the clock (while inaccurate), has a nice large display, easy to read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Happy with this coffee maker
reviews.reviewText: This is our second of the same model. The difference in the newer model is there is no longer a temp for how hot to keep the coffee, but it still seems hot enough. It look nice in stainless. As some others have mentioned, pouring the coffee can dribble a little - i just pour slow and it is usually fine.one of the reasons we first purchased this model is that there is no beeping. previous coffee makers we had would beep when one, beep when turning off, etc. this one? SILENT... you wont be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Stopped working after four months
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Braun. The first one lasted years. I brew one pot per day. After one cleaning it stopped working. After hearing how bad customer is I am not sure I want to buy another Braun. Very disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite coffee maker
reviews.reviewText: This is my third Braun coffee maker. Only complaint is the heating pad wears out after about two years. The coffee flavor is great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
reviews.reviewText: I'm incredibly pleased with this purchase. It worked well right out of the package. Brews great coffee. Easy to use. No harsh plastic/chemical smells. I ran one batch of water through it and then it was ready to go. I've had bad experiences with previous purchases where there is a strong chemical/plastic smell. There was no odor with this one. I've only just started using it, so I can't comment on durability, but seems to be fine in this regard if I had to guess. Will update if not.

I'm not a big fan of coffee maker coffee. Over the last 2 decades, I've alternated between pour over coffee set ups (Hario and Chemex), Brazilan press coffee (Bodum) and stove top espresso, for my daily coffee routine. However, due to the nature of my last job, I invested in a an automatic drip coffee maker. After extensive research, that almost had me buying a Bonavita or the more expensive Moccamaster, I settled on this model for a number of reasons. I am glad I did. This is an excellent machine that produces an excellent, robust coffee. The machine is easy to clean and is also easy to program for automatic coffee preparation at a desired time in the day. The only thing I'm not a huge fan of is the glass carafe, but I've learned to accept it. For those that don't mind having their coffee cook in a glass carafe on heated base, this machine will do the trick. I personally don't like the taste of the coffee after it's been heated for a while, so I chose to empty the contents immediately in an insulated container.Oh, and it's quite easy to make less than full batches as well as to adjust the coffee strength.Excellent machine and great value!

Impressed about this coffee maker right out of the box. Easy to set up and use within a short time frame. The options in relation to brewing are easy to understand and use. Need a bit more clarification in regards to pulling out the basket after use given that it is not clear how much energy is required to pull the basket out. Overall, good investment and good product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked for 10mths ….I wish it still worked…
reviews.reviewText: The coffee maker makes great coffee… but, 2 weeks ago the unit broke. Everything seems to work but when pressing brew, nothing happens. How much time will I invest into this?? Ill keep tabs on the outcome, for now, Im at home no coffee and can only call customer service on Monday… (add pissed off emoji here)
If you're looking for a coffee machine, this is the machine to buy. Even cheap coffee tastes better with this! Easy to use, easy to clean and looks amazing!
